subject: Relationships
title: The Speed of Trust
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Speed of Trust usable.

hook.text: Two companies with equal talent compete. The one with higher internal trust moves faster. Trust is a speed advantage.

buildup.text: Stephen Covey argued that trust changes everything â€” it makes every interaction faster and cheaper.

discovery.text: Low-trust environments require more contracts, oversight, and bureaucracy. High trust eliminates friction.

twist.text: A handshake deal in a high-trust culture closes in minutes. In a low-trust culture, it takes months and lawyers.

climax.text: Trust isn't soft. It's the hardest competitive advantage there is â€” because it takes years to build and seconds to lose.

punchline.text: Trust is speed. Low trust adds cost, bureaucracy, and delay to everything.

quiz.question: How does trust affect organizational speed?
options: High trust makes every interaction faster
